analyzed: paṭisambhidā magga
translated: The Path of Discrimination🔽The Pair

analyzed: yuga naddha vagga
translated: The Supramundane

original: Katame dhammā lokuttarā?🔽Cattāro satipaṭṭhānā, cattāro sammappadhānā, cattāro iddhipādā, pañcindriyāni, pañca
analyzed: katame dhammā lokuttarā  cattāro satipaṭṭhānā cattāro sammappadhānā cattāro iddhipādā pañca indriyāni pañca
translated: What are the supramundane states?

original: balāni, satta bojjhaṅgā, ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo, cattāro ariyamaggā, cattāri ca sāmaññaphalāni, nibbānañca—
analyzed: balāni satta bojjhaṅgāḥ ariyaḥ aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggo cattāro ariya maggā cattāri ca sāmañña phalāni nibbānañca
translated: The four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four bases of psychic power, the five spiritual faculties, the five spiritual powers, the seven factors of awakening, the noble eightfold path, the four noble paths, the four fruits of asceticism, and nibbana—

analyzed: ime dhammā lokuttarā
translated: these are the supramundane states.

analyzed: lokuttarā ati kenaṭṭhena lokuttarā  lokam taranti iti lokuttarā  lokāḥ uttaranti iti lokuttarā
translated: In what sense are they supramundane?🔽They cross over the world—thus they are supramundane.

analyzed: lokataḥ uttaranti iti lokuttarā  uttaranti iti lokuttarā  lokam atikkamanti iti lokuttarā
translated: They go beyond the world—thus they are supramundane.🔽They transcend the world—thus they are supramundane.🔽They go beyond the world—thus they are supramundane.

analyzed: lokam samatikkamanti iti lokuttarā  lokam samatikkantā ati lokuttarā  lokena atirekā ati lokuttarā
translated: They go beyond the world—thus they are supramundane.🔽They have gone beyond the world—thus they are supramundane.🔽They are superior to the world—thus they are supramundane.

analyzed: taranti iti lokuttarā  lokāḥ nissaranti iti lokuttarā  lokataḥ nissaranti iti lokuttarā
translated: They cross over the end of the world—thus they are supramundane.🔽They escape from the world—thus they are supramundane.🔽They escape from the world—thus they are supramundane.

analyzed: nissaranti iti lokuttarā
translated: They escape from the world—thus they are supramundane.

analyzed: lokāḥ nissaṭā ati lokuttarā  lokena nissaṭā ati lokuttarā
translated: They are ‘beyond the world’ because they have escaped from the world.🔽They are ‘beyond the world’ because they have escaped from the world.

analyzed: lokamhā nissaṭā ati lokuttarā  loke na tiṭṭhanti iti lokuttarā
translated: They are ‘beyond the world’ because they have escaped from the world.🔽They are ‘beyond the world’ because they do not stand in the world.

original: Lokasmiṁ na tiṭṭhantīti—lokuttarā.🔽Loke na limpantīti—lokuttarā.🔽Lokena na limpantīti—lokuttarā.
analyzed: lokasmin na tiṭṭhanti iti lokuttarā  loke na limpanti iti lokuttarā  lokena na limpanti iti lokuttarā
translated: They are ‘beyond the world’ because they do not stand in the world.🔽They are ‘beyond the world’ because they do not stick to the world.🔽They are ‘beyond the world’ because they do not stick to the world.

analyzed: loke a salittā ati lokuttarā  lokena a salittā ati lokuttarā  loke an upalittā ati lokuttarā
translated: They are ‘beyond the world’ because they are not mixed up with the world.🔽They are ‘beyond the world’ because they are not mixed up with the world.🔽They are ‘beyond the world’ because they are not smeared by the world.

analyzed: lokena an upalittā ati lokuttarā  loke vippamuttā ati lokuttarā  lokena vippamuttā ati lokuttarā
translated: They are ‘beyond the world’ because they are not smeared by the world.🔽They are ‘beyond the world’ because they are freed from the world.🔽They are ‘beyond the world’ because they are freed from the world.

analyzed: lokāḥ vippamuttā ati lokuttarā  lokataḥ vippamuttā ati lokuttarā  lokamhā vippamuttā ati lokuttarā
translated: They are ‘beyond the world’ because they are freed from the world.🔽They are ‘beyond the world’ because they are freed from the world.🔽They are ‘beyond the world’ because they are freed from the world.

analyzed: loke visaññuttā ati lokuttarā  lokena visaññuttā ati lokuttarā  lokāḥ visaññuttā ati lokuttarā
translated: They are ‘beyond the world’ because they are detached from the world.🔽They are ‘beyond the world’ because they are detached from the world.🔽They are ‘beyond the world’ because they are detached from the world.

analyzed: lokasmim visaññuttā atilokuttarā  lokataḥ visaññuttā ati lokuttarā  lokamhā visaññuttā ati lokuttarā
translated: They are ‘beyond the world’ because they are detached from the world.🔽They are ‘beyond the world’ because they are detached from the world.🔽They are ‘beyond the world’ because they are detached from the world.

analyzed: lokāḥ sujjhanti iti lokuttarā
translated: They are ‘beyond the world’ because they are purified from the world.

analyzed: lokatas sujjhanti iti lokuttarā
translated: They purify from the world: they are supramundane.

analyzed: sujjhanti iti lokuttarā  lokāḥ visujjhanti iti lokuttarā
translated: They purify from the world: they are supramundane.🔽The world is purified: they are supramundane.

analyzed: lokataḥ visujjhanti iti lokuttarā  visujjhanti iti lokuttarā
translated: They purify the world: they are supramundane.🔽The world is purified: they are supramundane.

analyzed: lokāḥ vuṭṭhahanti iti lokuttarā  lokataḥ vuṭṭhahanti iti lokuttarā  lokamhā vuṭṭhahanti iti lokuttarā
translated: They emerge from the world: they are supramundane.🔽They emerge from the world: they are supramundane.🔽The world emerges: they are supramundane.

analyzed: lokāḥ vivaṭṭanti iti lokuttarā  lokatas vivaṭṭanti iti lokuttarā
translated: The world turns away: they are supramundane.🔽They turn away from the world: they are supramundane.

original: Lokamhā vivaṭṭantīti—lokuttarā.🔽Loke na sajjantīti—lokuttarā.🔽Loke na gayhantīti—lokuttarā.
analyzed: lokamhā vivaṭṭanti iti lokuttarā  loke na sajjanti iti lokuttarā  loke na gayhanti iti lokuttarā
translated: The world turns away: they are supramundane.🔽They do not stick to the world: they are supramundane.🔽They do not get caught up in the world: they are supramundane.

analyzed: loke na bajjhanti iti lokuttarā  lokam samucchindanti iti lokuttarā  lokam samucchinnattā ati lokuttarā
translated: They do not get bogged down in the world: they are supramundane.🔽They cut off the world: they are supramundane.🔽The world is cut off: they are supramundane.

analyzed: lokam paṭippassambhenti iti lokuttarā  lokam  lokassa a patha ati lokuttarā
translated: They calm the world: they are supramundane.🔽The world is calmed: they are supramundane.🔽They are not the path of the world: they are supramundane.

analyzed: lokassa agatī iti lokuttarā  lokassa avisayā ati lokuttarā
translated: They are not the destination of the world: they are supramundane.🔽They are not the domain of the world: they are supramundane.

analyzed: lokassa asādhāraṇā ati lokuttarā
translated: They are not shared by the world: they are supramundane.

analyzed: lokam vamanti iti lokuttarā
translated: They are supramundane since they are free from the world.

analyzed: lokam na pacca avamanti iti lokuttarā
translated: They are supramundane since they do not return to the world.

analyzed: lokam pajahanti iti lokuttarā  lokam naḥ upādiyanti iti lokuttarā
translated: They are supramundane since they abandon the world.🔽They are supramundane since they do not cling to the world.

analyzed: lokam visinenti iti lokuttarā  lokam naḥ ussinenti iti lokuttarā
translated: They are supramundane since they are free from the world.🔽They are supramundane since they do not enter the world.

analyzed: lokam vidhūpenti iti lokuttarā  lokam na sandhūpenti iti lokuttarā
translated: They are supramundane since they are free from the world.🔽They are supramundane since they do not enter the world.

analyzed: lokam samatikkamma abhibhuyya tiṭṭhanti iti lokuttarā
translated: They are supramundane since they stand having overcome the world.

analyzed: lokuttara kathā niṭṭhitā
translated: The discussion of the supramundane is finished.
